title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Wednesday 7 June 2017 - BBC News
summary: armed police hunt two men in bridgnorth after car fails to stop .
more council-funded homes to be built in telford .
rod stewart performs tonight at the greenhous meadow .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening .

documents.title: watch : market looking for 'fresh blood '
text: an indoor market in oswestry has been celebrating its 60th birthday today , but according to one stall holder , margaret edwards , they could do with some fresh blood .

documents.title: football : five teenagers sign first shrewsbury town contracts
text: five teenagers have signed their first contracts at shrewsbury town .
they are defenders ryan sears and callum roberts , midfielders chris gallagher and george hughes , and striker john mcatee .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : your weather for tonight and tomorrow
text: for most places today has been dry and sunny - here 's how tonight is looking and the start of thursday .
keep updated with the bbc weather website .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: rod stewart concert : things you might need to know
text: if you 're going to see rod stewart at shrewsbury town 's stadium tonight , you 're being warned you ca n't take in food , drink , bottles , cans or cameras .
only cameras on mobile phones will be allowed and there will be catering vans inside and outside the stadium .

the show starts at 18:30 and is due to end at around 23:00 and people are being encouraged to walk or use park and ride services , because oteley road will be closed between the meole brace and weeping cross roundabouts until midnight .

documents.title: celebration for oswestry market
text: oswestry 's country market has celebrated its 60th birthday today .
it runs in parallel with the town 's regular market and there was a celebratory cake for stall-holders and shoppers .

documents.title: more council-funded homes to be built in telford
text: a home-building scheme run by telford and wrekin council , is being extended to hadley .
the council launched nuplace last year , with the aim of building 400 affordable homes - hadley joins randley , madeley and dawley .
the new street being created will have 25 homes , which should be ready by 2018 , and will be called blossom walk .
the title was suggested by 10-year-old owen eggerton , who won a competition to name it .

documents.title: cricket : bears look to t20 warm-up games
text: with no county championship games until 19 june , warwickshire 's one-day side will be getting some t20 practice this week , with two friendly games against shropshire .
the matches are being played back-to-back on friday at bridgnorth cricket club , with the first one starting at 11:00 .
the bears are due to start their t20 blast campaign away to worcestershire on 7 july .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: eyewitness describes police chase through centre of bridgnorth
text: a shopkeeper in bridgnorth has described seeing a white car chased through the centre of bridgnorth by the police .
abid mustafa said , `` i looked outside and this white car just went by shop at quite a good speed '' and then described how he went the wrong way down two one-way streets .
the police carried out a search earlier with armed officers , and say they are still hunting for two men who were in the car .

i was really , really , very worried because this time of day you 've got lots of parents with their kids and elderly people and you know , with recent events in london and manchester we 're all on the edge . ''

documents.title: police record over 60 offences involving cars or bikes on pavements
text: police in warwickshire and west mercia have recorded 64 incidents of cars or bikes driving or riding on the pavements over the past five years .
figures released by the two forces show 24 of the 36 offences involving cars were reported in the warwickshire area , the bulk of them in 2013-14 .
the statistics also show no real movement upward or downward .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Online

documents.title: football : telford make double signing
text: afc telford united have completed the double signing of the former brackley town utility player jordan gough and former worcester city winger chekaine steele .
new deals have also been agreed with zak lilly ( below ) , jonathan royle , dan westwood , and paul mccone .
afc telford united have now completed 13 signings ahead of the new season .

documents.title: cricket : krikken blames wicket for final day collapses
text: shropshire director of cricket karl krikken said his side 's struggles against wales were partly down being forced to play on a `` poor '' wicket in pontarddulais .
they were able to escape with a draw , but not after losing 16 wickets on the final afternoon and krikken said it was because rain water had been able to get under the covers and on to the pitch .
shropshire 's next matches will be two t20 friendlies against birmingham bears at bridgnorth on friday .
it was n't the fault of the ground staff .
they worked hard and they got us on .
it was just basically a poor wicket due to the weather and water getting under the covers .
it was deemed playable by the umpires and we had to play . ''

documents.title: your photos : blue sky over ludlow and myddle
text: we 've still got a fair amount of cloud over the county , but we 're seeing some blue sky now .
these photos were taken by bbc weather watchers near ludlow ( top ) and myddle ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: whitburn street reopens after manhunt
text: whitburn street in bridgnorth is open again and armed officers have left the scene .

they 've been searching for two men after a vehicle failed to stop for a police car earlier this afternoon and had the street cordoned off , with people living and working there being told to stay inside their buildings .
it 's not clear yet if the two men have been located .

documents.title: people on whitburn street urged to stay indoors
text: whitburn street remains cordoned off and officers have told people to stay inside their buildings .
armed officers are hunting two men whose car failed to stop for police earlier .
west mercia police says extra officers will be on patrol around the town while the search continues .
we ca n't open our door and look out , because someone walked from one of the premises and the police told us to get back into our own premises very quickly . ''

documents.title: bridgnorth eyewitness describes police incident
text: a woman with an office on whitburn street in bridgnorth says she locked herself in when armed officers turned up this lunchtime .
the police have part of the street cordoned off and armed officers are involved , but they have emphasised this incident is not terrorist-related .

maggie rogers said she saw a car race down the street in the wrong direction and that was quickly followed by the arrival of the police , and there are now officers with sniffer dogs searching the area .
we initially thought it was a terrorist incident , but we were very reassured that we had police officers armed here as quickly as they were . ''

documents.title: police say bridgnorth incident not terrorist related
text: the incident in bridgnorth is not terrorist-related , police say .
they say officers are dealing with a vehicle which failed to stop for police after hitting another car on bridgnorth high street and a building in waterloo terrace .
the officers are looking for two men who got out of the peugeot when it stopped .

documents.title: breakingpolice cordon off street in bridgnorth
text: police have cordoned off part of whitburn street in bridgnorth and armed officers have been seen .
the ambulance service say they have n't been called .

documents.title: whitchurch man faces jail after crash which killed shrewsbury father
text: a 21-year-old whitchurch man has been warned to expect a significant jail term after he admitted causing the death of a father-of-two from shrewsbury ( below ) by dangerous driving .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: general election : green party candidate wants to see more police
text: the green party candidate for the shrewsbury and atcham constituency has told a bbc shropshire debate she wants to see more police officers on the beat .
emma bullard also said the police and the nhs were working on the goodwill of public sector workers because of government cuts .
and responding to questions about security , ms bullard said her party would fund `` more police officers on the streets to make those relationships in communities '' .

both the police and the health services are working on the goodwill of those public sector workers who are having to work extra shifts , who are having to lose days off , because of the cuts to front line staff . ''

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 marginal seats in general election
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , we 'll be reflecting on the impact marginal seats could have on tomorrow 's general election .
politicians are crisscrossing the country , including this region , as the final hours of campaigning play out .
i 'll be looking at the whole on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: general election : ukip candidate promises 20,000 more officers on the beat
text: ukip 's candidate for the shrewsbury and atcham constituency , edward higginbottom says his party is promising to put 20,000 officers back on the beat , if it won power .
he says the cost of funding the initiative of £ 600m , would come not from raising taxes but by other means .
we 're looking at moving money that we currently spend on overseas aid , under the barnett formula , and our contribution to the european union .
we 're going to reuse that to pay for the various things that we want to do . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hopes that 'knife angel ' will make impact in london
text: the man who created a 26ft statue of an angel made almost entirely out of knives says he hopes that it will make a real impact in london .
alfie bradley , from oswestry , has been creating the so called knife angel for more than two years .

it 's made up of 100,000 knives collected from uk police forces across the country and there are plans for it to be erected in trafalgar square on the fourth plinth , to raise awareness of knife crime .
i just hope it 's going to make a difference , make a change .
i 've had a few gang members come up to see the angel with groups , with different charities .
as soon as they read the messages , it creates a massive impact and you can see that it proper touched them . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: general election : lib dem candidate commits to spend more on the police
text: hannah fraser , standing for the liberal democrats in shrewsbury , said her party would spend an extra £ 600m on the police , but that it was `` not all about money '' .
she told a bbc radio shropshire debate her party also wanted to focus more on community policing to combat new forms of terrorism .
ms fraser said that her party wanted to see the police budget spent differently .
west mercia police has lost 321 officers since 2010 a cut of 13 % .
we think that in order to combat these new kinds of crime and new kinds of terrorism that we are seeing , we need to focus much more on community policing '' .

documents.title: football : tns start road to champions league qualifiers with win
text: the new saints got their pre-season friendlies off to a winning start last night , beating an anglesey games side 3-1 at park hall .
there were goals from alex darlington , adrian cieslewicz and jacob farleigh .
tns a matches against brickfield rangers and a trip to scotland before their first champions league qualifier is played .

documents.title: general election : labour candidate worried about further police cuts
text: the labour candidate for the shrewsbury constituency , dr laura davies , says she is worried about the impact of further cuts on the police and other public services .

in a bbc radio shropshire debate she was asked why the police should n't be asked to make efficiency savings and she replied that while `` nobody likes waste '' public services were down to the bare bones .
and dr davies said the `` sensible way '' to grow the economy was to invest in the public sector .
people have made the efficiency savings , they have already been made .
people are having to make front-line cuts because they have squeezed every last drop of efficiency savings . ''

documents.title: more than 40 drivers caught drink driving in summer crackdown
text: forty five drivers have been caught either drinking and driving or driving while under the influence of drugs , in the first week of west mercia police 's summer crackdown .
twenty four drivers had been drinking and 21 had been taking drugs .
over the past three years , 122 people have been killed or seriously injured in west mercia as a result of collisions involving drink or drugs .
almost half of drivers involved in collisions causing death or serious injury involving drink or drugs , were aged between 17 to 30 and 82 % of those were men .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: general election : conservative candidate says crime has fallen despite reduction in officer numbers
text: the conservative candidate for the shrewsbury and atcham constituency was keen to point out that crime has fallen , despite a reduction in the number of police officers .
daniel kawczynski was speaking in the last of the constituency election debates on bbc radio shropshire .
the number of officers in the west mercia force has dropped by 13 % since 2010 .
mr kawcyznski says there 's understandably been a lot of interest in security since the latest terror attack in london , but officer numbers were n't to blame .
people have tried to criticise mrs may for cutting numbers of police officers when she was home secretary .
crime at the same time in shrewsbury , has gone down significantly .
so it 's not just about numbers .
it 's very much about empowering the police . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : shropshire escape wales with draw
text: shropshire struggled on the final day of their rain-affected minor counties championship game against wales , but managed to escape with a draw and eight points .

they lost a day and a half to the weather and the draw looked most likely when they went out to bat yesterday afternoon , but after being bowled out for just 77 in their first innings they were heading for defeat at 15-6 in their second innings .
in the end shropshire were able to see out the game and closed on 38-6 .

documents.title: ring road reopens after crash
text: the a5 around shrewsbury has reopened after an earlier crash which caused long delays stretching back towards the a49 and up the m54 .
a man was taken to hospital following the collision between a lorry and a car that happened between the preston and emstrey islands at just after 08:00 .

documents.title: long delays on a5 around shrewsbury
text: there are still long queues around shrewsbury 's outer ring road this morning because of a crash between the preston and emstrey roundabouts involving several vehicles .
traffic is backing up from the a49 and m54 directions .
the # a5 is closed southbound between the # a5064 and the # a49 near # shrewsbury due to a multi-vehicle collision .
more info to follow .
still shut ?
good morning , closure remains in place @ twitterid leading this incident .
keep checking @ twitterid feed for updates .

documents.title: conservationists set up 'curlew cam '
text: conservationists who monitor curlew populations in the county have launched an online `` curlew cam '' allowing viewers to see live footage of a curlew nest in south shropshire .
the shropshire hills & welsh marches curlew recovery project is asking the public for their help , by reporting sightings of curlew , snipe and lapwing .

documents.title: rock legend rod stewart performs tonight in shrewsbury
text: musician rod stewart is performing at the greenhous meadow in shrewsbury tonight in a one-off gig .
doors open from 16:00 with the concert starting at 18:00 .
rod 's daughter ruby and her friend alyssa bonagura , who together are in the band the sisterhood are his support act for the evening .
she says it was inevitable she 'd become a singer , given the musical link in the family .
we 've grown up around music our entire lives .
i mean my dad was playing temptations and otis reading in the house , he got me and my little sister hooked on the temptations when we were like 7 .
he 's really guided my whole listening and my ear , he 's kind of gauged and guided throughout my whole life . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wheelchair racer sets world record
text: wheelchair racer ben rowlings has set his first ever world record .
the newport athlete has taken nearly 20 seconds off the previous best time for 5000m , in the t34 category for athletes with cerebral palsy .
the 21-year-old is on a great run of form , having already set three european records this season .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: the region will have a mainly dry day with plenty of morning sunshine and lighter winds than yesterday .
it will cloud over during the afternoon and some rain will reach herefordshire and shropshire later .
highs of 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Mel Coles
Presenter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm here with all your news , sport , travel and weather this morning .
do get in touch if you have a story or you 'd like to share .
you can email .
tweet or get in touch via our facebook page .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: bridgnorth 's midwife-led unit to close overnight a third time
text: bridgnorth 's midwife-led unit will be closed overnight - the third closure in three weeks .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: cricket : shropshire asked to bat again
text: shropshire have been bowled out for just 77 in their first innings in pontarddulais and wales have asked them to follow on .
they were left trailing the hosts by 238 runs and after 10 overs of their second innings they 'd scored eight runs for the loss of one wicket .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: strong winds will continue overnight with gales over hills and more exposed areas .
showers will start to ease through the evening with some clearer spells developing .
lows of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: hundreds turn out to see corbyn visit telford
text: hundreds of people turned out in telford to hear jeremy corbyn speak - and he told them winning in shropshire was important to the party .
and he urged party activists to work right down to the last minute to persuade people to vote labour .
the conservative leader has also been in the region , visiting stoke and north wales today .
theresa may spoke about the threat of terrorism and said the security services needed to look at how they adapted to meet the changing methods the terrorists use .

documents.title: long-serving firefighters have some stories to tell
text: the two shropshire firefighters who are being honoured today for their long-service have seen some big fires in their time .

phil smith ( left ) and dave furber ( right ) spent days tackling the whixhall moss fire in the 1980s , they were at tern hill barracks to deal with the aftermath of the ira bombing in 1989 and they helped deal with the fire at mod donnington in 1983 .
the pair have more than 40 years service each , but they are n't the longest-service members of shropshire 's fire service .
north shropshire firefighter roger smith holds the record - he retired two years ago at the age of 70 after a 48-year career .
and the oldest uk firefighter of all time was alfred thompson , who had a 57-year career and he started out in whitchurch .

documents.title: football : the new saints return to action
text: it 's only been three days since the champions league final and the end of the 2016/17 season , but the new saints are back in action again tonight .
they 're playing a friendly against an anglesey games side , as they prepare for the qualifying rounds of next season 's champions league .
the draw for that first round of champions league qualifiers will be held on 19 june .

documents.title: corbyn makes health promises on visit to telford
text: the labour leader jeremy corbyn has been speaking at a rally in telford and promised that if labour wins the election he would invest more money in the nhs and suspend reviews of hospital services around the country .
he grew up in newport and also spoke about his childhood in the area and about it 's importance to industry .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury line up cardiff friendly
text: shrewsbury town have arranged to play a home friendly against championship side cardiff city on 25 july .
they are already scheduled to play aston villa on 15 july .

documents.title: does ploughing actually damage soils ?
text: does ploughing actually damage soils ?
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science, Environment & Rural Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: cricket : shropshire struggle on final day of championship match
text: callum taylor has taken four wickets for wales as shropshire have struggled to get going in their minor championship match .
the two sides have lost a day and a half to rain , making a result difficult and shropshire are currently 69-7 .

documents.title: man admits death by dangerous driving charge
text: a 21-year-old tilstock man has admitted causing death by dangerous driving .
joseph bonwick appeared before mold crown court this morning and also admitted a charge of causing injury by dangerous driving .
it relates to an incident on 2 april last year and he will be sentenced on 17 july .

documents.title: another delay for hospitals review
text: there 's been another delay to the review of hospital services in the county .
the future fit programme has spent over three years and millions of pounds deciding where services like accident and emergency and women and children 's services should be based .

the nhs team leading the review had hoped to put its plans to public consultation this summer , but a paper going before shropshire 's clinical commissioning group tomorrow says that will be pushed back , because they 've not been able to find someone to carry out an independent review of the work so far .

documents.title: cricket : play under way again in shropshire match
text: play is under way again in south wales , with shropshire replying to the home side 's 315-9 declared in their first innings .
the whole of yesterday was lost because of the rain and shropshire are expecting to have around 70 overs today .
shropshire are currently 30-1 .

documents.title: general election : telford conservatives get support from within county
text: while labour is wheeling out big-hitters like jeremy corbyn and john prescott to support the campaign of their candidate in the telford constituency , the conservatives have been looking to support from within shropshire .
both owen paterson and mark pritchard , the party 's candidates for north shropshire and the wrekin respectively , have been in the constituency supporting lucy allan in recent weeks .
meanwhile , the conservative leader , theresa may is just over the border today , campaigning in north wales .
lots of ex @ uklabour voters asking @ twitterid @ twitterid to `` stop @ twitterid running the country into the ground ''
meanwhile , in # telford town centre , slightly more people wait to listen to @ twitterid tell them why on june 8th they should # votelabour
jeremy corbyn was n't in power for last 7 years of borrowing £ 1.9tn , that was your party and for all that money 3 slogans .
ex labour voters ? !
look more like the local fox hunting committee to me pal !
on the flip side , i 'm normally a conservative and will be voting labour .
what a load of bollocks not even tories are voting for her
@ twitterid @ twitterid more pathetic , rubbish from the # liars party.so let 's get these exlabour voters to identify themselves .
whatever they are , i 'm not entirely convinced they have remembered who has been in charge 4 the last 7 years as country was run into ground
yessssss think they may have fingers in ears singing lalalala i cant hear you as well
lots !
you mean 4 !
there 's is n't tho , is there owen ?
nuts .
for 7 years you blukip no brainers have been wrecking this country
oh dear .
not quite drawing the crowds .
i hope you had enough tea bags !
kuldip , dylan & corbyn would be brilliant for the country # votelabour
i 'd just like to wish @ twitterid & the good people of @ twitterid all the best .
# telford # votelabour # voteforchange # jc4pm # ge2017

documents.title: watch : scientists try different approach to farming
text: scientists in shropshire are seeing if farmers can save money and do something for the environment by not ploughing fields .
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: general election : independent candidate wants more hospital services
text: while the nhs is talking about downgrading some services at telford 's hospital , the independent candidate standing in the wrekin constituency is calling for an expansion of the princess royal hospital instead .

speaking in a constituency debate on bbc radio shropshire , fay easton said that with the population of telford predicted to expand over the coming years , there could be no reduction of hospital services .
tonight , the five candidates for the shrewsbury constituency will be involved in their own constituency debate on bbc radio shropshire from 18:00 .

documents.title: tenancy deposit costs rise in telford and shrewsbury
text: the average cost of tenancy deposits for properties in telford and shrewsbury saw a hike at the beginning of the year , new figures show .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: general election : ukip candidate says telford has busier a & e
text: denis allen , who is contesting the wrekin constituency for ukip , says the accident and emergency at telford 's princess royal hospital is `` far busier '' than the one in shrewsbury .
but , he said his party will fight for two full a & es in the county , because there is `` no slack anywhere '' .
an nhs review has recommended basing emergency care at the royal shrewsbury hospital in the future and downgrading a & e services at telford 's princess royal hospital .

documents.title: cricket : hopes of play resuming in shropshire match
text: there will be another pitch inspection at 13:50 in south wales , and there is hope of play resuming this afternoon in the minor counties match between shropshire and wales .
there was no play yesterday , but they 're hoping to take an early lunch and start at 14:00 , with wales on 315-9 in their first innings .

documents.title: general election : green party candidate blames conservatives for hospital plans
text: the green party candidate for the wrekin constituency says he blames the conservatives for nhs plans to downgrade the accident and emergency department in telford .
pat mccarthy said the proposals , which also involve moving specialist maternity services to shrewsbury , were `` the thin end of the big wedge '' of austerity cuts .
mr mccarthy said he wanted a campaign to `` save all those services from the destruction that the tory party are bringing to them '' .

documents.title: cannabis factory discovered in outbuilding by police
text: police say they 've closed down a cannabis-growing operation near bridgnorth .
a smallholding in alverley was raided yesterday following a local tip-off .
the plants were found in a concealed area of an outbuilding .
police say a number of the plants had already been harvested and it looked like more were about to be harvested in the coming days .

documents.title: general election : lib dem says there is 'no case ' for loss of hospital services
text: the man representing the liberal democrats in the fight for the wrekin constituency has told a bbc debate there is `` no case '' for the loss of hospital services in telford or in shrewsbury .

an nhs review has recommended downgrading accident and emergency services at telford 's princess royal hospital and moving specialist maternity services to shrewsbury , with the more planned operations moving to telford .
but rod keys said there needs to be a `` full and proper clinical review '' before any major changes are made .

documents.title: man in hospital after house fire
text: a man in his 20s has been taken to hospital after a house fire in wellington this morning .
the fire services was called to market street at 03:26 and found the fire out when they arrived .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: general election : labour candidate wants to keep two full a & es
text: a clear dividing line between labour and the conservatives has appeared over accident and emergency services in the county , with the labour candidate for the wrekin constituency arguing shropshire needs to retain two full a & e departments .
dylan harrison told a bbc debate last night that because `` shropshire is a vast area '' it would n't be right to downgrade services in either telford or shrewsbury .
like his political opponents , mr harrison committed himself to fighting for services at the princess royal hospital .

documents.title: cricket : more rain forecast for shropshire match
text: there will be a pitch inspection at 11:00 in shropshire 's minor counties match against wales at pontarddulais .
there was no play yesterday because of heavy rain and there is more forecast for this afternoon .
on the first day the hosts scored 315 for nine .

documents.title: general election : conservative candidate says one a & e inevitable
text: the conservative candidate for the wrekin constituency says it 's inevitable that shropshire will lose some accident and emergency services , but he promises to fight to keep them in telford .

speaking on a bbc radio shropshire debate last night , mark pritchard said proposals to downgrade a & e services at the princess royal hospital had nothing to do with money , but had come about because the hospitals `` can not recruit the right people for the vacancies they have '' .
mr pritchard argued that telford should keep its full a & e department instead of shrewsbury , because the town has a growing population .

documents.title: council leader wants to keep swimming pool in town
text: the new leader of shropshire council says he 'll `` do everything possible '' to keep the quarry swimming pool within the loop of the river .
the council are looking at whether to keep the historic swimming pool in the middle of shrewsbury or build a new facility at the sports village in sundorne .
officers believe a new facility would offer better value for money .
the new leader , peter nutting says it 's not down to council officers but `` the councillors will be taking the decisions and that discussion has yet to take place '' .

documents.title: complaints from businesses as roadworks continue
text: businesses around shrewsbury 's abbey foregate say roadworks in the town are costing them thousands of pounds in lost trade .
they claim customers have stopped coming since the works on old potts way and haycock way started .
the roadworks on shrewsbury 's reabrook roundabout are going to take longer than expected , because of `` unforeseen buried drainage and difficult ground conditions '' .
shropshire council say the work , which was due to be completed by 2 july , will now continue until 26 july .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: peregrine falcon pair found dead on clee hill from poisoning
text: a pair of breeding peregrine falcons have been found dead at a shropshire site , leaving three vulnerable chicks in the nest .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: longest serving firefighters honoured
text: two shropshire firefighters are being honoured for their commitment to serving the county .
phil smith and dave furber have been together at wem fire station for more than 40 years each .

whenever phil and dave have turned out to a house fire , road crash , flood or rescue they have usually known the victims in the tight knit wem community they have collectively served for more than 80 years .

documents.title: video : is the wet weather going to hang around ?
text: it will be wet and windy at first but the heavy outbreaks of rain will clear .
this afternoon should be drier with some brighter intervals but blustery showers will continue with the risk of hail and thunder with highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: the team and i will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : resource issue to police terrorism
text: on midlands today this evening , we 'll be looking at whether our region 's police forces have enough resources to tackle terrorism .
following the latest attack in london , patrols have been stepped up and plans reviewed - but questions are being asked as to whether the police now have the money and staff they need .
we 'll be looking at what they have and what might be needed , on bbc one from 18:30 .
author: Giles Latcham
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: bid to raise £ 5k for telford woman 's wheelchair
text: a telford man is trying to raise £ 5,000 in order to buy his wife a new wheelchair .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: weather : more heavy rain forecast for tomorrow
text: this rain is forecast to stay with us tonight and into tomorrow .
temperatures should remain mild though , falling to around 10c ( 50f ) overnight .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: statue 'the nation 's monument against violence and aggression '
text: the knife angel statue at oswestry 's british ironworks is the `` nation 's monument against violence and aggression '' according to the man who runs the centre , clive knowles .
it is being moved to a new location , close to the a5 today , but he would like to see it placed on the empty fourth plinth in trafalgar square .
mr knowles said the statue , made of 100,00 knives , took on even greater significance following recent terror attacks .
this angel is dealing with a very significant problem that the country is wrestling with right now , which is violence . ''

documents.title: college shows signs of improvement
text: standards at north shropshire college have improved , but more work still needs to be done , according to an ofsted report released today .
the report says the partnership set up with reeseheath college in cheshire , to improve standards , is having a `` positive impact '' and the college is no longer rated as being `` inadequate '' .

ofsted inspectors visited the college at the start of last month and say despite the progress being made , the changes have `` not yet resulted in consistently good teaching , learning and assessment '' .

documents.title: lorry and coach block roads in ludlow
text: ludlow is getting back to normal after police had to help a large lorry and a coach load of tourists , which had become stuck in the centre of town .

shropshire council has closed off brand lane , so that workmen can work on gas , water and electricity supplies and the two vehicles tried to get around it by driving up the bullring and down king street .
it took around two hours to back the coach and the lorry out and shropshire council says it will try to speed up the work on brand lane and make the proper diversion routes clearer to motorists .

documents.title: miniature snail colony discovered
text: a new population of desmoulin 's whorl snails has been found in the marshes near whitchurch and they are believed to be the first discovered in the midlands .
they are usually just 3mm tall and are on endangered lists across europe , with populations in southern england on the decline .
the creatures became famous 20 years ago when they nearly derailed plans for the controversial newbury bypass in berkshire , and they had to be moved following protests .
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: labour leader to visit telford
text: jeremy corbyn will be coming to telford tomorrow .
the labour leader is coming to support the party 's candidate in there , kuldip sahota and he will be at southwater from 16:00 .
the seat is also being contested by lucy allan for the conservatives , susan king for the lib dems and luke shirley for the green party .

documents.title: several shropshire properties on 'at risk ' list
text: a new list of significant british buildings at risk of falling into disrepair includes eight in shropshire .

the up my street - buildings at risk catalogue has been put together by the campaign group save britain 's heritage and features more than 100 buildings which the author , liz fuller , says are in need of new owners or new uses .

the list includes a number of shropshire properties up for sale , such as the white horse hotel in wem and the crown inn in claverley , along with old colehurst manor , just outside market drayton ( above ) , which has been sold today .
there are also a number of rural cottages on the list , such as hill end cottage at linley ( below left ) and lane end cottage at plasau ( below right ) .
the report says lane end `` may be the most ruinous entry in this year 's register '' .

documents.title: old colehurst manor sold to private buyer
text: old colehurst manor , a grade ii listed house near market drayton , has been sold to a private buyer the day before it was due to go to auction .
the 17th century building had belonged to the former professional golfer bjorn teksnes and auctioneers harman healy had given it a guide price of £ 450,000 .
the london-based firm described the former wedding venue as an `` imposing building '' which `` requires a programme of renovation '' .
heritage campaigners have gone further , previously highlighting its plight .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: sports broadcaster returns to shropshire
text: the tv quiz-show host and sports broadcaster jeff stelling is back in the county today .
he is raising money for the prostate cancer charity by walking the equivalent of 15 marathons in 15 days , from exeter to newcastle .
today 's leg from kidderminster will end at shrewsbury town 's greenhous meadow football stadium early this evening .
mr stelling was in shropshire in april for a sportsman 's dinner at the new saints stadium .

documents.title: knife angel on the move
text: the 26-foot `` knife angel '' at the british ironworks centre , near oswestry , is being hoisted by crane through the roof of its workshop this afternoon .
the statue is being moved from the workshop where it was made to a spot in the ironworks grounds , near the a5 .
it is intended to encourage awareness of violent knife crime in the uk and is made of made from 100,000 knives .
the people who made it hope it can be put on the fourth plinth in trafalgar square in london later this year .

documents.title: police commissioner not calling for extra anti-terror resources
text: extra funding is not currently needed to combat the threat of terrorism in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire , according to the police and crime commissioner for west mercia .

john campion said the force could `` manage with the resources it has at the moment '' and that there was an emphasis on `` making what we 've got more efficient '' , through the use of technology like smartphones .

mr campion , who represented the conservatives at the pcc elections , also said the answer to terrorism was `` not just about police numbers '' and that it was a `` constantly developing threat '' which he was constantly reviewing with senior officers .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Online

documents.title: villagers halfway to pub total
text: villagers in yorton who want to buy their local pub are now halfway towards their target .
the railway inn has been run by the same family for 80 years but is now under threat because they 've decided to sell up .
the villagers , and other pub-regulars , started their fundraising a fortnight ago and have put up boards in yorton , to update people on their progress .

documents.title: road closure worry for oswestry proms in the park
text: concert goers are waiting to hear how overnight road closures will affect them leaving a major event .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your photos : rain in norton and shifnal
text: it 's been a wet start to the day and this rain is forecast to stay with us .
here we have photos taken by bbc weather watchers in norton ( top ) and shifnal ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: council chief exec has 'heavy heart ' following terror attack
text: the chief executive of shropshire council says he watched the one love concert in manchester with his family with a `` heavy heart '' following the `` shocking terrorist attack '' in london at the weekend .
clive wright also said that `` our response must be to carry on '' whilst remaining vigilant for anything unusual .
tomorrow , a minute 's silence will be held in shropshire , out of respect for the victims of the london attacks and flags on council offices are flying at half-mast today .
certainly we must all feel that the world has entered a new and hopefully short era , through the actions of a few people who sadly place so little value on life , including their own .
at the same time it is nothing short of amazing seeing how people and communities are pulling together , when they could so easily pull apart . ''

documents.title: roadworks to take longer than expected
text: work on shrewsbury 's reabrook roundabout is going to take longer than expected , because of `` unforeseen buried drainage and difficult ground conditions '' .
shropshire council says the work , which began at the start of may , was due to be complete by 2 july , but it will now continue until 26 july .
the work has involved the closure of haycock way and part of old potts way , lane closures on the roundabout and temporary traffic lights .

documents.title: london attackers have 'no understanding of god , religion or humanity '
text: a doctor who works for an organisation set up to promote understanding of islam , says the people who carried out the terror attacks in london at the weekend have `` no understanding of god , religion or humanity '' .
wazim aslam , from shrewsbury , also called the attacks `` barbaric and inhumane '' .
mr aslam is a director of al-mawrid uk , which lists among its objectives developing `` religious and racial harmony among the citizens of the united kingdom '' .

documents.title: charity 's new boat sets sail
text: a canal boat , built specially for the lyneal trust , which provides holidays for disabled people , has headed out on its maiden voyage today .
the trust raised the money to pay for the shropshire lady , as one of its existing boats needed replacing .
it 's taken around nine months to build and this morning she set sail from the boatyard in stoke to her new home at lyneal wharf near ellesmere .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: motorcyclist dies in crash near oswestry
text: a motorcyclist has died after a crash near oswestry yesterday afternoon .
the man , in his 20s , was riding on the a483 at sweeney when the crash happened .
the driver of the other vehicle , a black hyundai , was unhurt .

documents.title: cricket : day two of match lost to rain
text: day two of shropshire 's minor counties championship match against wales has been abandoned , with heavy rain forecast all day in pontarddulais .
yesterday , wales scored 315 for nine , after a delayed start to the day 's play , with jack mciver taking four wickets and alex wyatt three .
if the rain eases , they will get under way again at 10:30 tomorrow .

documents.title: work on major roundabout to finish soon
text: shropshire council says there 's now just `` minor finishing-off works '' to be carried out on shrewsbury 's meole brace roundabout .
redevelopment of the island , which involves a new road being built through the middle of it , started back in february .
the council expects additional roadworks here to continue for another week .
delays and diversions are still in place at the reabrook island near the shirehall and old potts way .

documents.title: crews fight fire at builders ' merchant
text: a huge fire broke out at a builders ' merchant in ellesmere at the weekend .
six crews attended the blaze at the tudor griffiths site , which is believed to have been started in two large industrial machines and recycled wood and chippings on saturday evening .

documents.title: a49 'nightmare ' roadworks spell traffic chaos as talks continue to ease disruption
text: a 10-day closure of one of shropshire 's busiest trunk roads will be a `` nightmare '' - but there is no getting around it , motorists were told today .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: blue plaque unveiled in shropshire
text: a blue plaque has been unveiled in bishop 's castle to commemorate musician and singer songwriter , jerry lordan .
former radio 1 dj and chairman of the british plaque trust , mike read unveiled the plaque outside the three tuns in bishop 's castle .
the singer , musician and writer jerry lordan lived near the town and was nominated to receive a blue plaque as part of a bbc music day project .
he wrote the shadows ' hit apache and dozens of other well known songs for cliff richard , jet harris and tony meehan .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: rain gradually moving in from the west this morning , becoming heavy and persistent in some places this afternoon with highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: the tiny snail with a huge part to play
text: the tiny snail with a huge part to play
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science, Environment & Rural Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: i and the team will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire
